content.raw:
This will be the last of my issue tracker 'sensor spam' this evening. I'm proposing that we add an altimeter sensor to Gazebo. The sensor will simply report the vertical altitude relative to a reference height ('U' value in the ENU local tangent plane). 

GNSS (GPS, Galileo, GLONASS,etc.) altitude is normally terrible because of satellite geometry. So, multirotor platforms typically make use of barometric pressure sensors to measure altitude. The basic idea is that there is a fairly good relationship between atmospheric pressure and relative height, which you can exploit to estimate altitude. 

The change would be something along these lines in the model SDF:

```
#!xml

<sensor name="BMP180" type="altimeter">
  <pose>0.01 0 0.03 0 -0 0</pose>
  <noise>
    <type>gaussian</type>
    <mean>0.0</mean>
    <stddev>0.01</stddev>
  </noise>
</sensor>

```
